radiographic_examinations.findings: Did not show free air; evaluation of the bowel, particularly the posterior wall of the duodenum was limited due to extensive high density barium.

The liver demonstrates no focal abnormality; suggestion of increased hepatic echotexture, no definite fatty infiltration in comparison with recent CT; no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation; common bile duct mildly prominent at approximately 6 mm, less dilated compared to a previous measurement of 1 cm; gallbladder appears normal, pancreas tail is poorly evaluated.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Common bile duct was 1 cm previously, now measures 6 mm, indicating a decrease in dilation.
